meanings.definition: Formed by the collection of units or particles into a mass or whole.
meanings.sent1: The aggregate weight of the books was too heavy for the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The aggregate score of the team determined their ranking in the tournament.
meanings.sent3: The aggregate number of balloons in the room made it look like a colorful cloud.
meanings.sent4: Her aggregate knowledge on the subject impressed the professor.
meanings.sent5: The aggregate effect of the storm was visible in the flooded streets.

meanings.definition: The total amount or sum of individual parts.
meanings.sent1: The aggregate of coins in the jar amounted to five dollars.
meanings.sent2: The aggregate of votes decided the winner of the election.
meanings.sent3: The aggregate of ingredients in the recipe created a delicious dish.
meanings.sent4: The aggregate of stars in the sky formed a beautiful constellation.
meanings.sent5: The aggregate of colors in the painting made it vibrant and eye-catching.
